name: 'Star Trek' Guest Star Quiz | 'Star Trek' - Various Characters | 20 Questions

questions.text: This actor, born in Syria, has played many ethnic characters: Hispanic, Middle Easterner, Hawaiian, Native American. But he is best know to Star Trek fans as Kang, the Klingon. He is:
questions.explanation:
Michael Ansara & Mike Ansara & Ansara.

	He also played 3 roles on 'I Dream of Jeannie': King Kamehameha, The Blue Djinn, and Biff Jellico. In real life, he was married to Barbara Eden (Jeannie) for 16 years.

questions.text: This former Miss America was the central character in the TOS episode 'That Which Survives': Losira. She also starred in 'Time Tunnel' and 'Barnaby Jones'. She is:
questions.explanation:
Lee Meriwether & Meriwether.

	She was Miss America 1955. She also played the 2nd Catwoman in the campy 'Batman' TV show of the 1960's. She is related to Meriwether Lewis, 19th century explorer and later governor of the Louisiana Territory.

questions.text: This actor guest starred in two TOS episodes: Trelane in 'The Squire of Gothos' and Capt. Koloth in 'The Trouble with Tribbles'. (He reprised the latter for the Deep Space 9 (DS9) episode 'Blood Oath'.) He is:
questions.explanation:
William Campbell & Bill Campbell & Campbell.

	William Campbell has his own place in history in terms of the 'Paul is dead' rumors of the late sixties. He is the alleged 'imposter' who, with the aid of plastic surgery, replaced Paul McCartney in the Beatles after the latter's alleged 'demise.'

questions.text: This throaty-voiced actor played Worf's long-lost brother Kurn in 2 TNG and 1 DS9 episodes. He also played Jake Sisko as an adult in DS9 episode 'The Visitor'. He is:
questions.explanation:
Tony Todd & Anthony Todd & Todd.

	He also played the infamous Candyman in the horror movie trilogy.

questions.text: This actor played the Klingon Kor in 1 TOS and 3 DS9 episodes. He also played the treacherous Count Baltar in 'Battlestar Galactica'. He is:
questions.explanation:
John Colicos & Colicos.

	His performance as Kor was the first appearance of a Klingon in 'Star Trek' in TOS episode 'Errand of Mercy'.

questions.text: This actor played Kirk's son Dr. David Marcus in the second and third Star Trek movies. He also played T'Jon in the TNG episode 'Symbiosis'. He is:
questions.explanation:
Merritt Butrick & Butrick.

	Also played Johnny Slash in the TV series 'Square Pegs'.

questions.text: Which of the following actors has NOT guest starred on any 'Star Trek' TV series?
questions.explanation:
Harrison Ford.

	Steven Berkoff played Hagath in DS9 episode 'Business As Usual'. Bruce Hyde played Lt. Kevin Riley in TOS episodes 'The Conscience of the King' and 'The Naked Time'. Jill Ireland played the beautiful Leila Kalomi in TOS episode 'This Side of Paradise'.

questions.text: Which TOS regular cast member 'guest starred' as his character's brother?
questions.explanation:
William Shatner.

	He played the corpse of his brother George laying on the floor of his apartment on Deneva in TOS episode 'Operation - Annihilate!'.

questions.text: This actor's 'retirement' from Star Trek: Voyager was the suspenseful teaser to entice viewers to watch. But when the beginning credits rolled, their name was removed and Jeri Lynn Ryan's was in. Their name was then put in the list of guest stars after the first commercial break.
questions.explanation:
Jennifer Lien.

	Ooh, big surprise. Another spoiled departure was when Terry Farrell was to leave DS9. The TV Guide for the week following her departure detailed that her character, Jadzia Dax, was murdered. But the subscribers to the magazine got it before that episode aired. Big Jeers to them!

questions.text: Besides playing 'Boothby' in a TNG and two Voyager episodes, this actor played Uncle Martin in the series 'My Favorite Martian'. He is:
questions.explanation:
Ray Walston.

	He has won a Tony for his performance as the Devil in Broadway's 'Damn Yankees', two Emmys for television's 'Picket Fences', and become a household name playing the extraterrestrial Uncle Martin on TV's 'My Favorite Martian.'

questions.text: This young actress plays Naomi Wildman on Voyager.
questions.explanation: Scarlett Pomers.

questions.text: A regular cast member of Voyager, he has been a guest on TNG once and DS9 twice.
questions.explanation:
Tim Russ.

	He played T'Kar and Tuvok on DS9, and Devor on the TNG episode 'Starship Mine'.  He also played a human Lieutenant in the movie 'Star Trek: Generations'. He also tried out for the part of Geordi La Forge.

questions.text: One of the actresses that played the sisters of Duras.
questions.correct: Gwynyth Walsh & Barbara March & Gwyneth Walsh & Walsh & March
questions.explanation:
Gwynyth Walsh & Barbara March & Gwyneth Walsh & Walsh & March.

	The sisters died in 'Star Trek: Generations'.

questions.text: This actor played Worf's human foster brother, Nikolai Rozhenko. He also starred in 'Law and Order'.
questions.explanation:
Paul Sorvino.

	He is father to Academy-award winning acress Mira Sorvino.

questions.text: This actress played Nikolai Rozhenko's lover and Capt. Sisko's girlfriend-then-wife.
questions.explanation:
Penny Johnson.

	DS9: recurring role as Kasidy Yates.

questions.text: This actress has had 6 guest spots: 3 on TNG (once a Malcorian and twice a Romulan), 3 on Voyager (The holodeck character 'Mrs. Templeton'). She has also appeared four times on 'Quantum Leap', once as a ghost and 3 times as Zoey.
questions.explanation: Carolyn Seymour.

questions.text: He played The Clown in Voyager episode 'The Thaw'. He's better known for his role as Lenny on 'Laverne and Shirley'. He is:
questions.explanation:
Michael McKean & McKean.

	Hello!

questions.text: She's played Dr. Selar (TNG), K'Ehleyr (TNG), and a female Q (Voyager). She is:
questions.explanation:
Suzie Plakson.

	She also supplied the voice for Monica DiVertibrae on the sitcom 'Dinosaurs!'

questions.text: This actor played Steth on Voyager episode 'Vis-a-vis'. He's better known as Bulldog on 'Frasier'. He is
questions.explanation: Dan Butler & Butler.

questions.text: He's played the characters 'Annorax' and 'Thrax' on Voyager. He also played the Federation President in 'Star Trek: The Undiscovered Country'.
questions.explanation:
Kurtwood Smith.

	He went on to play Red Forman on 'That '70s Show'.
